metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7533 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the fsnotify implementation in the Linux kernel through 4.12.4 allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted application that leverages simultaneous execution of the inotify_handle_event and vfs_rename functions. Fan Wu and Shixiong Zhao discovered a race condition between inotify events and vfs rename operations in the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-89-generic - 4.4.0-89.112
linux-image-4.4.0-89-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-89.112
linux-image-4.4.0-89-lowlatency - 4.4.0-89.112
linux-image-4.4.0-89-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-89.112
linux-image-4.4.0-89-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-89.112
linux-image-4.4.0-89-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-89.112
linux-image-4.4.0-89-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-89.112
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-89-generic - 4.4.0-89.112
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-89.112').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1028.37').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1024.24').

linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
